top_categories.workout_context: 69ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Houffa Gravel's Belgian Ardennes, Hilly gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 65 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Houffa Gravel's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before August.
At Houffa Gravel, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Houffa Gravel. Train it until it feels boring.
When someone attacks on belgian Ardennes gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
65 miles on belgian Ardennes gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Varied gradients on belgian Ardennes gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Houffa Gravel, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on belgian Ardennes gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
Low-cadence force work for 4,500ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Houffa Gravel’s 65 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Houffa Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on belgian ardennes gravel to build confidence. Expect: belgian ardennes, hilly gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 65 miles of belgian ardennes gravel in Houffalize, Belgian Ardennes.
